business.headline: All-new Paytm app brings greater privacy, stronger security and control for usersReinforcing its commitment to being the safest UPI app in India, Paytm now prevents screen recording during UPI payments, adding a critical layer of security that protects users from potential fraud.

Gold stays firm amid wedding demand. Time to buy?Gold continues to shine, backed by festive demand and supportive global trends. But with prices already high, many are wondering if the rally still has room to run or if caution is the smarter bet.

Sensex, Nifty reverse early losses to end higher fuelled by IT and auto stocksThe S&P BSE Sensex added 335.97 points to close at 83,871.32, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 120.60 points to end at 25,694.95.

PhysicsWallah IPO: Is it a good bet or should investors skip the listing?PhysicsWallah IPO will remain open for bidding from November 11 to November 13, 2025, with the allotment to be finalised on November 14, 2025.

Equity inflows fall 19% in October despite market rise: AMFIAmong equity categories, most still managed to bring in money, but with mixed momentum. Flexicap funds remained the most sought-after option, collecting Rs 8,928 crore, a solid 27% rise month-on-month.

Warren Buffett signs off: Key takeaways from his final letter to shareholdersThe 95-year-old investor, who has led Berkshire for nearly six decades, announced he will no longer write the company's annual reports or address shareholders at the annual meeting.

Rs 80,000 crore lying unclaimed: Why families fail to access loved ones' savingsFamilies in India are losing track of their own inheritance. With Rs 80,000 crore unclaimed, financial advisers warn that the problem is not wealth creation, but the absence of clear records, nominations and open discussions at home.

Gold at Rs 1.25 lakh, Silver extends gains: Why are prices rising again?Gold prices surged to Rs 1.24 lakh and silver neared Rs 1.55 lakh amid easing U.S. shutdown worries and Fed rate-cut hopes. Should investors buy now or wait for dips?

Bajaj Finance share price crashes 8%: What's behind today's slide?Shares of Bajaj Finance crashed nearly 8% today after solid earnings were overshadowed by a trimmed growth outlook and rising asset stress.

Want better SIP returns? Follow the 10-7-10 mantra, says expertSIP investors often look for the magic formula to grow wealth faster. According to an expert, the 10-7-10 mantra may be the closest thing to one — a simple, disciplined approach that can potentially boost long-term returns.

Government updates pension rules: Parents must file this document for 75% benefitParents receiving family pension from the government must now file this key document every year to keep the 75% benefit. The revision is part of a new effort to reduce errors and incorrect payouts.

Pine Labs IPO closes today: Is it worth betting on for listing gains?The Rs 3,899.91 crore IPO is a book-built issue, consisting of a fresh issue of 9.41 crore shares worth Rs 2,080 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of 8.23 crore shares worth Rs 1,819.91 crore.

Mutual fund SIPs vs direct stocks: Where should young professionals bet?For young professionals, the lure of direct stocks, instant control, multi-bagger dreams, and social-media bravado is understandable. Yet four decades of global and Indian evidence reveal a sobering pattern: discipline and diversification, not adrenaline and instinct, drive enduring wealth creation.

Tata Motors CV arm to list on November 12: What investors should knowTata Motors' decade-long restructuring reaches its final stage as its commercial vehicles arm lists on November 12. What this means for investors, share allotments, and how trading will begin?

Bajaj Finance share price falls 7% after Q2 results. Should you buy the dip?Bajaj Finance shares plunged nearly 7% after Q2 results showed solid profit growth but weaker guidance and rising asset stress. With valuations still rich, is this a buying opportunity?
Sensex, Nifty flat despite positive global sentiment, Q2 earningsThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 242.13 points to 83,293.22, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 72.35 points to 25,502.00 as of 9:32 am.

Groww IPO listing: Strong debut or muted opening on cards? Check what GMP saysThe parent company of Groww, Billionbrains Garage Ventures Ltd, saw massive investor interest during the subscription window. Groww allotment was finalised on November 10.

Not every IPO is a jackpot: How to know if an IPO is really worth your moneyMany retail investors still go by hype, brand names, and subscription figures rather than understanding whether the issue is actually worth investing in.

PhysicsWallah IPO opens today: Should you subscribe? Here's what GMP indicatePhysicsWallah's Rs 3,480 crore IPO consists of a fresh issue of 28.44 crore shares worth Rs 3,100 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of 3.49 crore shares worth Rs 380 crore.

Think missing an EMI is harmless? The impact can last yearsMost borrowers don't plan to miss an EMI, yet life can get in the way. But what feels like a small slip today can turn into a long-term hurdle when you need credit the most.

entertainment.headline: Sex or conversation? Vicky Kaushal's choice leaves Kajol and Twinkle in splits Vicky Kaushal humorously prioritised good sex over good conversation on 'Two Much with Kajol and Twinkle'. His remark sparked laughter in the talk show.

KBC 17: Watch Harsh Gujral, Abhishek Upmanyu, Anubhav Bassi, Ravi Gupta join Big B Stand-up comedians will take centre stage on the upcoming episode of 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 17'. A new promo shows Harsh Gujral, Abhishek Upmanyu, Anubhav Singh Bassi, and Ravi Gupta joining Amitabh Bachchan for a lively and humorous episode.

Arshad Warsi on his children joining Bollywood: Why would anyone bet on my son? Arshad Warsi opened up about his children's acting ambitions, asserting that nepotism doesn't guarantee success in Bollywood. He said he wouldn't use his connections to help them, adding, "Nobody can help anybody here - you have to make your own way."
Dulquer Salmaan's Kaantha lands in legal trouble ahead of release Just days before its scheduled release, Dulquer Salmaan's much-awaited film 'Kaantha' has landed in legal trouble.

Bhagyashri Borse calls Dulquer Salmaan Emperor of Acting Bhagyashri Borse thanks director Selvamani Selvaraj, Rana Daggubati, and Dulquer Salmaan as 'Kaantha' nears its release date, speaking openly about her experience on the project.

Gatha Vaibhava trailer: Suni's blend of fantasy and reality keeps you guessing The trailer of 'Gatha Vaibhava', an upcoming fantasy romance film starring debutant SS Dushyanth and Ashika Ranganath, presents multiple worlds blending fantasy into reality.

Nargis Fakhri marks 14 years of Rockstar, shares BTS moments with Ranbir Kapoor On 'Rockstar's 14th anniversary, Nargis Fakhri shared an unseen behind-the-scenes video with Ranbir Kapoor, calling the film a journey that "changed her life completely." The actor reflected on how her debut role as Heer still lives within her, even after all these years.

Rajamouli's Globetrotter: Mahesh Babu's entry and more details on upcoming event SS Rajamouli's 'Globetrotter' event is currently trending across the nation for the scale at which the teaser release is being planned. Here's everything you need to know about the teaser launch event scheduled for November 15.

DC Crime: Jimmy Olsen leads Superman spin-off series as narrator and investigator DC Studios has launched 'DC Crime', a new spin-off featuring Jimmy Olsen as an investigator. The series blends true-crime style with metahuman mysteries, exploring deeper social themes.

Sandeep Reddy Vanga joins Nagarjuna and Ram Gopal Varma to discuss Shiva legacy As the cult classic 'Shiva' gears up for its 4K Dolby Atmos re-release, filmmaker Sandeep Reddy Vanga joins Nagarjuna and Ram Gopal Varma for a nostalgic conversation on how the film changed Indian cinema forever.

Ram Gopal Varma praises Ram Charan for Chikiri song, calls it explosive Ram Gopal Varma, known for his outspoken opinions and controversial remarks, surprised fans by showering praise on Ram Charan and Buchi Babu Sana for their latest song 'Chikiri Chikiri' from 'Peddi'.

Kim Kardashian slams psychics after bar exam setback: Pathological liars Kim Kardashian has criticised psychics in a new TikTok video after failing the California Bar Exam, despite predictions she would pass. The reality star earlier reflected on her legal journey and expressed her determination to continue pursuing law.

Gauri Khan's making memories moment with Rani Mukerji, Karan Johar. Video Gauri Khan shared glimpses of her recent travels and outings with her mother Savita Chhibber, Rani Mukerji, Karan Johar, and close friends, calling it a time for "making memories."

Chinmayi Sripada voices concern on sexual grooming amid Jani Master controversy Chinmayi Sripada expressed concern over the sexual harassment allegations against choreographer Jani Master on social media. She also reflected on consent and how the ecosystem enables abusers.

Jolly LLB 3 OTT release: When, where to watch Akshay, Arshad's courtroom drama After a successful box-office run, the courtroom drama 'Jolly LLB 3' is ready for its digital debut. The film is expected to be available on not one but two OTT platforms.

Priyanka Chopra alerts fans to stay safe amid chaos and fear after Red Fort blast Actor Priyanka Chopra reacted to the deadly blast near Delhi's Red Fort that killed 10 and injured many. The incident has prompted widespread grief and a strong call for justice and heightened security.

Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar trailer event pushed after Red Fort blast The team of 'Dhurandhar' on Tuesday informed the media that they have decided to postpone the film's trailer launch event in Mumbai, citing the Red Fort blast that occurred on Monday night.

Bomb threat at Ajith Kumar's Chennai residence, police call it hoax Ajith Kumar's Chennai home was subjected to a bomb threat, leading to a search operation by authorities and raising concerns amid a series of similar incidents targeting public figures across the city.

Huma Qureshi: Rani Bharti is home, Delhi Crime's Badi Didi is a challenge In an exclusive interview with India Today, actor Huma Qureshi reflected on his role as Badi Didi in 'Delhi Crime 3. Qureshi said how the character was far more difficult to inhabit.

general news.headline: NDA keeps Bihar in style, Prashant Kishor fails to impress, 8 exit polls predict Live updatesAll exit polls project the NDA to win more than 130 seats, comfortably surpassing the 122-seat majority mark in the 243-member Bihar Assembly.

Pakistan PM jumps to blame India for Islamabad suicide blast that killed 12Within hours of the suicide blast in Islamabad in which 12 people were killed, Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif blamed India for it. He also alleged New Delhi's role in the attack on a cadet college in Wana on Monday, saying Afghan Taliban was acting as "India's proxy". Sharif's allegations came without any evidence.

Live: Lal Quila metro station to remain closed on Wednesday over security concernsA massive blast occurred in a Hyundai i20 near Gate No. 1 of Delhi's Red Fort Metro Station around 6:50 pm on Monday, as the slow-moving vehicle stopped at a red light. The explosion killed ten people, while several others were critically injured and rushed to hospitals. Investigating agencies have invoked the anti-terror law, UAPA, in the FIR, suspecting it to be a planned terror attack. Key cities, including Delhi and Mumbai, along with several states, are on high alert. Stay tuned to IndiaToday.in for the latest updates.

One Faridabad hospital, radicalised doctors, Jaish link: Delhi blast lowdownAt the centre of it all is Al-Falah School of Medical Sciences & Research Centre in Faridabad, where most of the doctors currently in custody, including Dr Shakil and Dr Shaheen, had worked.

How Delhi blast broke the terror patternThe deadly blast outside Delhi's Red Fort came after 14 years and was a break from a terror pattern. Though the security agencies seem to have foiled a bigger terror attack, the explosion that killed 12 near the Red Fort brought back memories of terror's dark days.

Amit Shah safe as he knows Modi's secrets, must resign: Priyank Kharge on Delhi blastKarnataka ministers Priyank Kharge and M B Patil slammed Union Home Minister Amit Shah over the Delhi blast, alleging security lapses. Both demanded Shah's resignation, citing repeated failures.

The Faridabad plot to destroy DelhiThe busting of the Faridabad module is a story of meticulous police work that likely saved Delhi from the biggest terror strike of the decade. It began with a serendipitous discovery in faraway Kashmir.

Bihar records 67.14% turnout in Phase 2, highest-ever for the state Live UpdatesBihar elections Phase 2: Several crucial seats from the regions of Magadh, Champaran and Seemanchal, widely known as a decider for every state election, are seeing voting today.

Hindu group takes CJI's lord Vishnu remarks to Times SquareMembers of the Hindu diaspora in the US gathered at Times Square in New York City to voice opposition to Chief Justice of India BR Gavai's remark regarding the restoration of a seven-foot Lord Vishnu idol at Khajuraho's Javari temple. Organised by Stop Hindu Genocide, the campaign urged respect for religious sentiments.

Arrested J&K doctor rented room for 2 months, stored explosives, never returnedDr Muzzamil Shakeel, a doctor from Faridabad's Al Falah Hospital, who was arrested after 360 kgs of explosives were found in his rented room in the city, paid a rent of Rs 2,400 for his room to store the explosives and never returned there, police sources said.

The New Luxury: How Republic of Nature Redefines Meaningful Living on ECRDiscover how Republic of Nature by GTB Developers is reshaping Chennai's East Coast Road with design-forward homes that blend luxury, nature, and mindfulness in one of India's most refined new communities.

12 killed in Islamabad court suicide attack, minister says Pak in state of warPakistan blast: The explosion at the heart of the Pakistan capital took place inside a parked vehicle at the Islamabad court complex.

Mom, Dad and Kriti: Tattoos help identify businessman killed in Delhi blastAmar Kataria, a 34-year-old pharma businessman based in Chandini Chowk, was killed in the Red Fort blast. His family identified the body with his distinctive tattoos dedicated to his parents and wife.

UP doctor arrested in terror module case was tasked to head Jaish's women's wingInitial investigation suggests that Dr Shaheen Shaheed was tasked with forming a female recruitment and operations network in India under the banner of 'Jamaat-ul-Momineen', the women's brigade of JeM, according to sources.

Delhi blast culprits to face our agencies' full wrath: Amit Shah orders manhuntUnion Home Minister Amit Shah has ordered a manhunt for "each and every culprit" behind the car blast near Delhi's Red Fort that claimed 10 lives, saying they would face the full wrath of investigative agencies.

Asim Munir's military coup in Pakistan, without the militaryThough Pakistan has seen coups and military dictators, the coup being staged by army chief Asim Munir is unprecedented. Through the 27th Constitutional Amendment, Munir is getting sweeping powers. The "constitutional coup" would dismantle Pakistan's remaining democratic safeguards and permanently alter its civil-military balance.

Was bookworm, our only hope: Red Fort blast suspect's family stunned over terror linkDelhi blast: Dr Umar, a member of the Faridabad-based terror module that was busted last week, was believed to be in the Hyundai i20 car that exploded near Delhi's iconic Red Fort.

They'll love us again: Trump says tariffs on India to be reduced in fair trade dealThe US President said that discussions with India have made significant progress and both sides are edging closer to a balanced agreement. He also said the US would eventually bring down tariffs on India.

No job for my friends: Nikki Haley's son differs with her on H-1B, immigrationNalin Haley, son of former UN Ambassador Nikki Haley, called for ending H-1B visas and halting legal immigration, blaming foreign workers for youth unemployment in the US. The 24-year-old also called for British-American journalist Mehdi Hasan to be thrown out of the country. Nalin said people who hate America should leave the country.

Pak at war, cities now target: Minister Khwaja Asif as Islamabad blast kills 12Pakistan's Defence Minister Khawaja Asif declared the country is "in a state of war" after a deadly suicide bombing near Islamabad's judicial complex killed 12. He called the attack a wake-up call, warning that peace talks with Afghanistan's Taliban-led government are unrealistic amid escalating cross-border terrorism threats.

Bengal tea seller buys dream scooter for daughter with coins he saved over 4 yearsThe tea shop owner arrived at a scooter showroom with a drum full of small coins he had saved for four years for his daughter's dream ride.

CCTV reveals 3 men took i20 for pollution check 2 weeks before Red Fort blastIn the video, dated October 29, one man wearing a shirt can be seen speaking to booth officials while two others - a man in a grey t-shirt and another in a white t-shirt with a backpack - arrive at the scene.
Dharmendra responding to treatment and is recovering: Hema MaliniVeteran actor Dharmendra is responding to treatment and is recovering, according to his family.

sports.headline: Two fans die due to cardiac arrest on second day of ATP Finals in Turin Two spectators, aged 70 and 78, tragically died of cardiac arrests on the second day of the ATP Finals in Turin despite prompt medical intervention. The FITP and ATP paid condolences following the passing of two spectators.

Spin-friendly pitch? Eden curator reveals talk with coach Gambhir before 1st Test India vs South Africa: With India wary of rank turners after last year's 0-3 defeat to New Zealand, Eden Gardens curator Sujan Mukherjee has promised a sporting pitch for the opener. The surface is expected to offer bounce early and gradual turn later, keeping both pacers and spinners interested across five days.

800 days and counting: Babar Azam equals Virat Kohli as wait for century prolongs Babar Azam's century drought stretched to 800 days as he was dismissed for 29 in the ODI series opener against Sri Lanka. The Pakistan skipper showed flashes of class early on but was ultimately outfoxed, leaving his wait for a hundred to continue after 83 innings.

Lionel Messi to visit Hyderabad in December: Telanagan CM confirms with new poster Lionel Messi will visit Hyderabad on December 13, 2025, as part of his 'GOAT Tour to India 2025'. Telangana CM Revanth Reddy confirmed the news by unveiling an official poster announcing the football legend's arrival.

IPL 2026 auction to be held in Abu Dhabi on 15 or 16th December: Sources The Indian Premier League (IPL) auction is heading back to the Gulf, with Abu Dhabi set to host the upcoming IPL 2026 mini-auction in mid-December, sources told India Today.

Bangladesh bounce back to stifle Ireland with spinners in Sylhet Test Bangladesh staged a strong comeback to restrict Ireland after the visitors made a promising start. Paul Stirling and debutant Cade Carmichael built a solid foundation, but Mehidy Hasan Miraz and Hasan Murad triggered a middle-order collapse.

Anvay Dravid, named in India U-19 B squad for Afghanistan tri-series in Bengaluru Anvay Dravid, son of Rahul Dravid, has been named in India's Under-19 B squad for the upcoming tri-series in Bengaluru. He continues to rise up the ranks in youth-level cricket.

After quiet Aus tour, Shubman Gill sweats in optional session before Kolkata Test India vs South Africa: Captain Shubman Gill led from the front in an optional training session at Eden Gardens on Tuesday. The star batter spent 90 minutes in the nets, taking on both spin and pace in the lead-up to the series opener on 14 November.

Shaheen Shah Afridi: I became Pakistan captain only after Rizwan decided to resign PAK vs SL: Shaheen Shah Afridi revealed that he became Pakistan's ODI captain only after Mohammad Rizwan voluntarily stepped down from the role, following discussions between them and the PCB.

Pakistan pacer Naseem Shah's ancestral home attacked with gunshots, none harmed Unknown assailants fired at the gate of Pakistan pacer Naseem Shah's ancestral home in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, but with no injuries reported, he chose to stay with the team for the ODI against Sri Lanka as police investigate the incident.

England will enjoy bouncy Australian pitches, suits our style: Marcus TrescothickAssistant coach Marcus Trescothick said England are confident of thriving on Australia's fast, bouncy pitches in the upcoming Ashes, believing the conditions will suit their aggressive style of play. He also backed Joe Root to shine in the series.

Ian Botham slams England's Ashes build-up: Not the way I would prepareIan Botham has questioned England's decision to play just one internal match in Australia before the start of the Ashes, warning that the visitors could arrive underprepared for one of cricket's toughest challenges.

Ben Stokes in beast mode: Ben Duckett fires strong warning to Australia for AshesLeft-handed batter Ben Duckett has praised captain Ben Stokes' intense preparation ahead of the Ashes, calling him "crucial" to England's chances of ending their 14-year wait for a Test series win in Australia.

IPL 2026 retention prediction: Will Mumbai Indians release Deepak Chahar?As the Mumbai Indians gear up for IPL 2026, they will look to fix several glaring weaknesses in their squad ahead of the mini-auction. Can they bet on Deepak Chahar for another season after a poor show in 2025? Here is a probable list of players the five-time champions might retain on the deadline day.

Australian tabloid calls Joe Root Average Joe: Ashes banter or disrespect?The Australian media has launched sharp verbal attacks on England's Joe Root and Ben Stokes ahead of the Ashes Test series, starting November 21. Australia are favourites to beat England in the much-awaited five-Test series.

Former World No.2 Ons Jabeur announces pregnancy with husband Karim KamounFormer World No. 2 Ons Jabeur has announced that she is expecting her first child with husband Karim Kamoun and will be taking a break from tennis to focus on her well-being. Atiqa Mir continues meteoric rise, secures historic pole, podium in COTFA seriesAt just ten years old, Atiqa Mir made history as the first female driver to secure pole position in the COTFA Mini class, marking a significant milestone for Indian motorsport with Formula 1 support. Special toss coin featuring Mahatma Gandhi, Nelson Mandela for Kolkata TestIndia vs South Africa, 1st Test: A special gold coin bearing Gandhi and Mandela will be used for the toss, marking a symbolic start to the Freedom Trophy Test at Eden Gardens on November 14.

Jammu & Kashmir script history, beat Delhi for first time in 65 yearsQamran Iqbal stood unbeaten on 133, while incisive spells from Auqib Nabi and Vanshaj Sharma guided Jammu & Kashmir past Delhi, securing their maiden Ranji Trophy victory over the capital side.

Liverpool face uphill task in Premier League title race after City loss: Andy RobertsonLiverpool defender Andy Robertson admitted that his side faces an uphill battle in the Premier League title race after their loss to Manchester City. Liverpool have already lost five matches in the Premier League this season.

Sunil Chhetri leads footballers' plea for ISL restart: Anger turns to desperationIndian footballing fraternity has urged football authorities to expedite the start of the Indian Super League season, saying players are "desperate" to return to action. In a social media statement, he said footballers are united and ready to play immediately.

England's Bazball approach evolving from reckless and entertaining: Ben DuckettEngland's Ben Duckett is saying that the Bazball approach is evolving ahead of the all-important Ashes series. England have adopted an ultra-aggressive approach since Brendon McCullum took over as the coach of the Test team.

Ashes: Australia's Mitchell Starc calls for spicy wickets over five-day TestsAustralia pacer Mitchell Starc has called on curators to prepare lively, bowler-friendly pitches for the upcoming Ashes series, stressing that financial motives to stretch matches to five days should not influence pitch preparation.

IND vs SA: No rank turner requested by India for Eden Gardens opener, says GangulySourav Ganguly confirmed that India has not sought a turning track for the Eden Gardens Test against South Africa, with the pitch expected to be a sporting surface offering balanced assistance to both batters and bowlers.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
